doc:
William Ball (director) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Ball_(director) 0 William Gormaly Ball (29 April 1931 – 30 July 1991) was an American stage director and founder of the American Conservatory Theatre (ACT). He was awarded the Drama Desk Vernon Rice Award in 1959 for his production of Chekhov's Ivanov and was nominated for a Tony Award in 1965 for his production of Molière's Tartuffe, starring Michael O'Sullivan and René Auberjonois. He was also a noted director of opera. William_Gormaly_Ball ( 29_April_1931 – 30_July_1991 ) was an_American_stage_director_and_founder of the_American_Conservatory_Theatre ( ACT ) . He was_awarded the_Drama_Desk_Vernon_Rice_Award in 1959 for his_production of Chekhov 's_Ivanov and was_nominated for a_Tony_Award in 1965 for his_production of Molière 's_Tartuffe , starring Michael_O'Sullivan and René_Auberjonois . He was also a_noted_director of opera .
